Key Match Events: Australia squeeze past Afghanistan by 4 runs
Rashid Khan's late assault nearly stole the pursuit of 168 for eight
Rashid Khan scored 48 not out in the final over
Post-Match Reflections: Australia's fate is now in other hands, with their only path to the semi-finals requiring a Sri Lanka win over England on Saturday
Miscellaneous Highlights: Afghanistan is an altogether hardier side than the one that shipped 417 runs against Australia in the 50-over World Cup of 2015
Rashid Khan limped off Adelaide Oval on Tuesday with a badly jarred knee, then bowled beautifully and batted like a demon come Friday night
Others: Australia hit speed bumps before the match: Aaron Finch, the captain, and the finisher Tim David ruled out with hamstring injuries
Kane Richardson replaced Mitchell Starc and was lashed for 48 runs in his allotment
